Yes, Ramakrishna placed great emphasis on devotion as a means of achieving spiritual awakening. Here are a few more resources that focus on that aspect of his teachings:

1. "Sri Ramakrishna: The Personification of Godliness" by Swami Saradananda - This book is a detailed biography of Ramakrishna's life and teachings, with a particular emphasis on his teachings on devotion. It provides a wealth of stories and anecdotes that illustrate the importance of devotion in his life and teachings. 2. "Ramakrishna: His Life and Sayings" by Max Müller - This book is a classic work that provides an overview of Ramakrishna's life and teachings, including his emphasis on devotion. It includes quotes and stories from Ramakrishna's life that illustrate the importance of devotion in spiritual practice. 3. "Teachings of Ramakrishna" edited by Swami Abhedananda - This book is a collection of teachings and stories from Ramakrishna, with a particular emphasis on his teachings on devotion. It includes insights into various spiritual practices, such as chanting, prayer, and meditation, and how they can be used to cultivate devotion. I hope these resources are helpful in your exploration of Ramakrishna's teachings on devotion!
